"TheSnoring Sunv", said the scientist to the reporter.
The scientist was amazed at the sound of the sun, how it could be so loud and yet so soft.
The reporter was amazed at the size, how it could be so gigantic and yet so small.
The sun would snor more than ever, for it was not a star, but an orb, a planet, a star in its own right.
It was the same sun, but smaller than ever, for it was not an orb, but a planet, a sun in its own right.
